We are a place where everyone can discover their creative potential and find a love for music. Our school offers individual and group lessons in a wide variety of musical styles, from classical to contemporary styles. We have professional teachers who will help you to master your chosen instrument or develop your vocal talent with great care and patience. We strive to create an inspiring atmosphere where every student feels comfortable and supported, as well as finding musical friends and like-minded people. Our pupils have the opportunity to take part in concerts, master classes and other musical events, which helps to unlock their creative potential and allows them to gain valuable stage experience. We believe that music is not only an art, but also a means of self-expression and personal development, and we strive to inspire our students on the path of musical discovery and self-realization. Join our musical family and discover the magical world of sounds and emotions with us!" Learning in our music school is an individualized process, focused on the needs of each student. Here's how tuition usually works: Consultation and selection of a training program:The first step is a consultation with your teacher to determine your musical goals and preferences. Based on this information, an individualized study program is drawn up that is tailored to your level of training and desires. Lessons with an instructor:In the selected program, you take lessons with a professional teacher. During the lessons you learn music theory, master the technique of playing the chosen instrument or develop your vocal range and expressiveness. Practice and homework:Regular practice outside of lessons is an important part of learning. By doing homework and exercises, you consolidate what you have learned and develop your musical skills. Participation in events and concerts:Our school regularly organizes concerts, master classes and other musical events in which students can participate. This is a great opportunity to showcase your talent, get feedback and gain stage experience. As for the content of the training, it may include the following aspects depending on the tool or direction chosen: Game Technique:Mastering the basic techniques and methods of playing the chosen instrument. Music Theory:Study of music notation, harmony, rhythm, and other basic concepts of music theory. Interpretation and expressiveness:Developing the ability to convey emotions and express their musical vision through performance. Repertoire:Study and practice playing a variety of music in different styles and genres. Solfeggio and auditory learning:Development of musical hearing, ability to recognize melodies, chords and rhythms.
